main event: An observer sighted flickering lights in the northwest sky in Kettering, Ohio, that appeared to be two points of light remaining stationary for about 10 minutes.
interesting points: The sighting occurred on March 29, 1954., The observer had previously been a private pilot with extensive flight experience., The object was not identified as a helicopter despite the observer's initial impression., The observer did not file an official report at the time., The sighting lasted approximately 10 minutes with the lights appearing stationary.
witness description: The observer is an experienced private pilot.
